name: New Caledonia
description: New Caledonia, an overseas territory of France in the southwest Pacific Ocean, is a volcanic archipelago renowned for its dramatic landscapes, unique biodiversity, and rich cultural heritage. Characterized by rugged mountains, pristine beaches, and lush rainforests, it offers a diverse range of experiences for nature lovers, adventure seekers, and those interested in exploring a fascinating blend of French and Melanesian cultures. The islands boast a remarkable level of endemism, with many plant and animal species found nowhere else on Earth.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The vibrant capital city, located on the northwest coast.
quickFacts.detail: Nouméa is a bustling port city and the administrative center of New Caledonia, offering a mix of French and Melanesian influences.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: A relatively small population spread across the islands.
quickFacts.detail: The population is comprised of Kanaks (indigenous Melanesians), Europeans, and people of mixed descent.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: The main islands include Grande Terre, Ouvéa, Lifou, and Île-du-Pin.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The local currency used throughout the territory.
quickFacts.detail: It's pegged to the Euro, but has its own distinct symbol and exchange rate.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, alongside Kanak languages.
quickFacts.detail: Kanak languages are recognized as official languages in certain contexts.

quickFacts.label: Time Zone
quickFacts.description: New Caledonia operates on a time zone ahead of Coordinated Universal Time.
quickFacts.detail: This results in a significant difference in daylight hours compared to many other regions.

climateData.title: Tropical Climate with Oceanic Influences
climateData.description: New Caledonia experiences a tropical climate with distinct wet and dry seasons. The oceanic influence moderates temperatures, resulting in relatively stable conditions throughout the year. Rainfall is concentrated during the wet season, while the dry season offers sunny skies and pleasant temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Characterized by high humidity, frequent rainfall, and lush vegetation.  The landscape is at its most vibrant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny days with lower humidity.  Ideal for outdoor activities and exploring the coastline.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Transition Seasons (April/May & October/November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A transitional period with gradually changing weather patterns.  Temperatures remain warm, but rainfall increases.

naturalWonders.name: Île des Pins
naturalWonders.description: Île des Pins, meaning 'Pins Island,' is a volcanic island renowned for its pristine beaches, turquoise waters, and abundant marine life. It's a haven for divers and snorkelers, offering a glimpse into a vibrant coral reef ecosystem.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island's volcanic origins have created a dramatic landscape of rugged cliffs and sheltered bays.  Its isolation has contributed to its unique biodiversity, including several endemic bird species.

naturalWonders.name: Cascade de Wadjam (Waterfall)
naturalWonders.description: The Cascade de Wadjam is a spectacular waterfall cascading down a sheer cliff face into a refreshing pool. It's a popular destination for hikers and nature enthusiasts seeking a tranquil escape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Located in the heart of the Bougainville Mountains, the waterfall is surrounded by lush rainforest and offers stunning views of the surrounding landscape. The pool at the base is perfect for a cooling dip.

naturalWonders.name: Mount Panié
naturalWonders.description: Mount Panié, the highest peak in New Caledonia, offers breathtaking panoramic views of the island and the surrounding ocean. It's a challenging but rewarding climb for experienced hikers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is a dormant volcano, and its slopes are covered in dense rainforest.  The summit offers a 360-degree view of the archipelago.
viewingTips: Check weather conditions before setting out

biodiversityCategory.name: Endemic Flora and Fauna
biodiversityCategory.description: New Caledonia boasts an exceptionally high level of endemism, with a significant proportion of its plant and animal species found nowhere else on Earth. This is due to the islands' isolation and unique evolutionary history.

statistics.details: Approximately 80% of the plant species are endemic.
More than 50 bird species are endemic, including the Kagu, a flightless bird with a distinctive call.

notableSpecies.name: Kagu
notableSpecies.significance: A unique flightless bird endemic to New Caledonia, known for its distinctive call and shy nature.

notableSpecies.name: New Caledonia Rosewood
notableSpecies.significance: A valuable timber tree that is threatened by habitat loss and illegal logging.

ecosystemData.title: Rainforest Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: New Caledonia's rainforests are incredibly diverse and play a crucial role in the islands' biodiversity. They cover a significant portion of the main island and are home to a vast array of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforest
biodiversityCategories.description: Dominated by towering trees, dense undergrowth, and high humidity.

statistics.details: A remarkable diversity of tree species, many of which are endemic.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Mangroves
biodiversityCategories.description: Found along the coastlines, these salt-tolerant forests provide vital habitat for marine life and protect the shoreline from erosion.

statistics.details: Several mangrove species are endemic to New Caledonia.

activities.title: Outdoor Adventures in New Caledonia
activities.description: New Caledonia offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all levels of experience, from hiking and diving to cultural tours and wildlife viewing.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the diverse landscapes of New Caledonia on foot.

activities.name: Mount Panié Summit Hike
activities.description: A challenging but rewarding hike to the summit of Mount Panié, offering panoramic views.
activities.requirements: Good fitness level, hiking boots, water, sunscreen

activities.name: Bougainville Mountains Trails
activities.description: Explore a network of trails through the Bougainville Mountains, discovering waterfalls and rainforest scenery.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the crystal-clear waters of New Caledonia with a variety of water sports.

activities.name: Diving at Île des Pins
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Île des Pins.

activities.name: Snorkeling at Ouvéa
activities.description: Discover the colorful coral reefs and diverse marine life of Ouvéa.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, waterproof jacket, sweater
